intro: Sida ovata, commonly known as the roundleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its ovate leaves, which are usually hairy and have a rough texture. Sida ovata produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
